title: Irelia Champion Spotlight it's misleading.
body:
Now, that you removed Irelia's her unique things to her kit (meanwhile {{champion:84}} still has true stealth), you gotta redo her Spotlight video. It's misleading, since {{champion:39}} dosen't do bonus damage to shields with full Stacked passive and her ultimate dosen't disarm enemies. 
Let's not forget the changes that are on PBE right now, with her W damage reduction only applying to Physical damage now (Her spotlight shows her taking some good damage from Veigar's W).

Please redo her Spotlight video, since it's really misleading for players that don't read the patch notes, watch others read for them.

replies.body: Great rework you got there, if you have to change one of the promotional videos in less than a year of it coming out.

Spotlights are marketing material, not documentation. The wiki puts a big warning below every spotlight about not relying on these videos for actual info, and LoL has a load screen tip about keeping up with patch notes.

That said, those are some pretty significant mechanics changes. Gives the impression of correcting a major screw-up.

Oh and we ain't done there. More Irelia nerfs on PBE that are changes to her mechanics.

W is physical damage reduction.
Passive grants attack speed per stack instead of damage, now grants damage at max stacks.

^this

Why do you think there's still the original video for Zac, Garen etc. Its exactly as the guy above said.
Same with Rek'Sai {{champion:421}} spotlight. It still shows her old ultimate.

Of all of the champions that have been gutted, why Irelia?
I do not play her because I knew it would happen.. But we are stuck with the abomination that is Aatrox and the same awful Akali... Yet Irelia much be gutted?

Not really impressed by the idea of her being "op"

because in professional matches, the players know each other, their reactions and even have drills to react to situations.  One CC can stop her in her tracks and then if collapsed upon, the top or mid laner is instantly dead

whereas in solo queue, you have to guess what your team will do and play accordingly while irelia kills any injured target in sight

even then, it's completely crazy.  People wouldn't mind her numbers being higher if they'd just tone it down to where she has 2 dashes maximum but she can get as many dashes as there are minions nearby and one starting dash and up to 2 dashes per champ if she gets lucky or 3 dashes per champ if she manages to kill the target...

15 potential dashes is just weird and offers her the strongest mobility in the game even when she only gets a few, all while being incredibly mana efficient, farming efficient, sustain efficient...and she does everything

I guess time will tell, but the higher level players tend to complain about yasuo a lot less than irelia.  He's very popular everywhere

At top tiers, he is easier to take down than at lower tiers because players actually know what to do in a game and rarely troll as much.
But he is even viable in pro games in multiple roles.
Irelia, however, has an abysmal win rate in pro games (especially right now with her zero wins in LCK for Spring).

she is a generalist, but one of the worst ones.  Yasuo happens to be a better one

generalists are popular picks in pro league because they have less to worry about from the opposing team, but ironically the dedicated specialists are often better

Irelia's main problem is that her area of expertise is collapsing on separate, injured targets.  While she's a beast for the best in solo, professionals can easily collapse on her all at once and even have training scenarios for most situations that could happen
